description:
I am a man of my word I told which I'd assume is the owner of the pizza place that if this pizza was good I'd give a positive review and here it is, basically long story short friends and I were looking for a pizza for dinner and we were going around the area the prices for a lot of places are pretty expensive.

The owner tried to earn my business was very persistent and I appreciate that I decided to order his pizza especially after he dropped the price a little bit when I told him about the other place despite domino's down the street had a cheaper price for a good 3-6$ less for the same size in fact I could've gotten an X large from Domino's for almost the same price but I digress. 

The wait for the pizza was a little bit longer then expected I've seen only one guy cooking not too bad we were patient and ended up getting the pizza we ordered large pepperoni and then I ordered a Philly cheese steak with fries. For a one person order it took way longer then expected was good that I got to see it being made from the outside.

However on the menu on the wall it was $9.00 the owner flat out charges me 9.75 now if he told me it was tax that would be fine but he flat out told me "that is with the fries " which was incorrect on the menu it literally said with fries for the Philly cheese steak is $9.00 again if he told me the 75 cents was tax that is a different story. I decided to let him charge me the extra 75 and I even let him keep the extra 25 cents since he was persistent on keeping my business and not going down the street to a cheaper place. 

The Philly cheese steak and the pizza were really damn good my friend and his dad I asked them personally how they would rate the pizza and they both gave me the same rating, they both rate it a 4/5 and I agree with them wholeheartedly. However the quantity when it comes to the fries is freaking embarrassing man I cannot give this place a 5 because of it, the quantity was very small for the order as well as the fact that he charged me an extra 75 cents and I let him keep an additional 25 cents but yet they kind of short me on the fries and he dishonestly charges me extra when on the wall it says 9$ with fries? 

That is why I am only giving a 4 star out of 5 still a damn good rating the fact that I got deliberately charged extra when on the menu it was showing 9$ again if it was for tax that is a different story but he didn't say that the 75 cents extra was for tax he said it was for the fries. So that irks me quite a bit.

Unfortunately I won't be coming back just for that simple mistake unless they bother to attempt to do the same thing earn my business and all I'll give them that opportunity. On the flip side I did enjoy the pizza and Philly cheese steak and my friends enjoyed it as well.
author: R I.

description: Highly recommend the pepperoni pizza. The trick is that you need to order a whole pepperoni pizza. You're an idiot if you just get one slice that's been sitting out, and are fishing for quality in no mans land. Slices are for on the go, when you're expecting the lesser amount of quality. Although, I'm sure the slices are decent, don't go for the slices, trust me. This isn't your Golden Boy, that's a whole other pizza concept (disclaimed: I love Golden Boy). Order a whole pie and share it with friends. This pizza is my most favorite pizza in San Francisco. SimpIe, and made to order is always key. I don't know if it's just the impeccable accountability, but the reliability of the fact that this pizza is always fresh, perfectly rationed with pepperonis, and exposes the perfect amount of grease and love. It's damn good, and until you order one for yourself and eat it, take your negativity elsewhere. That crust to cheese and sauce ratio is fire, yo. Please stay open forever
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Hours are a lie. Here on a Saturday night with friends but it's closed, even though the hours say it's open. Lazy azzholes
author: M B.

description: I have been to the Irving Pizza on Irving St. in Sunset many times. I started working a project nearby this spot and decided to try it today. The pizza recipe is exactly the same. The pizza is thick crust and it's a little on the brittle side. The Hawaiian pizza was pretty good. This isn't my favorite pizza in SF, but it satisfies my belly. I wanted something cheap to much on and this slice was around $4.50. Easier than a burrito at Los Hermanos. Guy who works there was nice enough.
author: Denise C.

description: Great service and amazing pizza! The cheese is thick and stringy and the toppings were really fresh!i think it is family owned, they were really kind and fast!
author: Lorin E.

description: Pretty average pizza. Got a pepperoni slice and a pesto chicken slice. Seemed like it had been sitting out for a while; went on a wed at 8pm. $3.50 for a pepperoni slice that is average is a little pricey in my opinion.
author: Andruw M.

description:
Wait a sec... we're not on Irving. We're on Geary. I realize that they're related to the other Irving Pizza that is actually on Irving, but they seem rather attached to the name. This one is smaller than the Irving location. Between this location & the Irving location, Irving Pizza's delivery range covers about half the entire city, so that's commendable.

With just a couple of tables, it is more of a takeout counter. Get a slice or a whole pie if you want a snack, a meal, or need to satisfy a late night craving. 
They also serve burgers, subs, and the obligatory salads. Surprisingly, they also have deep-fried Oreos. 

Slices are pretty large and start at $3. Whole pies are also pretty affordable. 
If you can find inexpensive and filling food, it is a good reason not to cook. You were already trying to think of a reason not to cook on your way home from work anyway. 
Pizza + wings = not cooking tonight.

Mr. Joy had grown up eating Irving Pizza, so he has ordered from here several times. To me, the pizza is okay, but it is a little chewy & flimsy. I mentioned that we hadn't been getting enough vegetables, so his solution was to order the Green Special with pesto, artichoke hearts, feta cheese, basil, & garlic. It probably didn't help our nutrition intake, but at least the artichoke hearts provide some roughage, and basil is good for something, but I can't remember what. 

As for their wings, something is off. I have nothing against eating greasy fried foods. In fact, I enjoy them more often than I should, but these wings are no bueno. Maybe it's the heavy batter or dried out meat, but for lack of a better description, it nauseates me. You're probably reading this thinking, 'You're weird.' Yes I am.
author: Joy W.

description:
Slightly better than taking some of the cardboard from the street out front, heating it up, and spreading Safeway marinara on it and charged $3.99.
But really, it was unevenly warmed up, already burnt in spots and just plain bad. It was still early in the night around 8:30 so the drunks weren't there and the guy behind the counter still seemed to be angry I was buying anything.

Walk a block and change down to Maysoon's pizza, it's cheaper, better, (generally) fresh, and operated by some scary yet friendly locals.
author: Kurt N.

description: If this place wasn't across the street from my apartment I most likely wouldn't come here.  The pizza is perfectly fine but it isn't something to draw you to this part of San Francisco.  I think the prices are a little steep for the quality of pizza the serve but you can't really complain when it's quick mediocre pizza that gets the job done.
author: Maurice O.

description: If I could give this place 1 star, I would !  I ordered a vegetarian pizza and the person charged me two times for ONE PIE. Not only did this happen, the guy on the register that took the order was incredibly rude. When I got my pizza, there was meat on the pizza.... Imagine if someone who was allergic to a specific ingrediant, found that specific ingrediant. I COULD NOT EAT THE PIE SO I GAVE IT TO MY BROTHER.
author: Kyln L.

description:
We tried this place out last night (well, early this morning) as one of the few late night options available within walking distance -- ordered to go through eat24.  Although their hours are listed as open until 4am, the person I spoke with (either the manager or the owner) told me they actually close at 3am and that attempts to have this updated in their yelp profile have so far been unsuccessful.

I had the double bacon cheeseburger, my girlfriend had the Philly cheesesteak.  Both with fries.

The fries were pretty good, those big steak fries you used to get at places like Denny's or Lyon's before they started serving those shitty shoestring fries.

My burger: huge.  Two giant patties.  Unfortunately they were undercooked, more of something between rare and medium rare despite the fact I ordered it medium well.  Perhaps because the patties were so undercooked, the burger as a whole really didn't have that great burger flavor -- in fact, it was quite bland.  A couple bites in, and it tasted more like flavorless raw meat than a burger that had actually been cooked.  The bacon was also very hard.  The burger was a disappointment, but it certainly was large.

Her cheesesteak was also a disappointment; the flavors were OK but the portion of actual cheesesteak goodness was very small, and the bun was burnt, hard, and crunchy.  The sandwich would've probably been tasty had the bun not been burnt, but unfortunately the flavors of the burnt-to-a-crisp bun heavily overpowered the otherwise tasty (albeit sparse) cheesesteak.

Overall I'd say give this place a try if you're looking for a huge burger (but make sure they cook the meat properly), but definitely pass if you're looking for a good cheesesteak.
author: Michael G.

description: Honestly, the worst place you could ever have to deal with. Don't order from here. This company is a complete joke that cares very little if not nothing about the people they claim to serve. They won't deliver on time nor will they take ownership when they make a mistake. Truly one of the worst places you could ever try and conduct business with in the city of San Francisco.
author: Andrew L.

description: Great pizza.. however they take over an hour EVERY SINGLE TIME I order..which is a lot. It always gets here cold. Such a bummer.
author: CarlaGiselle S.

description: I ordered the chicken fingers with fries, and a slice of pepperoni & bacon pizza via Eat24. They totally disregarded my condiment selection, which is the lesser of the 2 issues. The slice of pizza was disgusting. They layered some uncooked bacon and barely melted mozzarella over an already cooked pepperoni slice. I posted the photo in the gallery. They refused to refund me through Eat24 since they claimed they made the order correctly, but I don't consider uncooked meat to be done correctly. One bite of that monstrosity made me nauseated.
author: Patricia M.

description: Low average pizza. dry. lacking taste.like chewing on cardboard.... customer service  just ok. So glad the guy behind the counter was cute. He wasn't very smart.
author: Chris W.

description: The pizza here is made with absolute minimal effort. Chipped in for the "wagon" size combo and it was a simple waste of money. The crust was undercooked, barely any cheese or sauce (which didn't have the greatest taste to begin with) and very greasy. Won't be ordering from this place again.
author: Andreea M.

description:
Great customer Service! I ordered a bacon burger and fries last night and they forgot the bacon they offered a to deliver a refund to me or bring me the proper burger most places just say o sorry. They really brought back the burger I was amazed. 

I ordered same thing again my second and last night in town for $10 a GIANT AND I MEAN GIANT burger and fries you can't go wrong deff worth it they forgot my peppercinnis but no biggey lol and there deep fried Oreos are to die for  this is my go to place
author: Alexis P.

description: Cool place to go for a quick lunch I was in and out the door in less than 5 minutes the pizza was hot it was pretty good the people working there seem like they enjoy being there I don't know why but that seems like a big deal to me a lot of places you go to people usually have crappy attitudes they have bottle Coke and Sprite the Mexican kind that's always good.
author: Jorge P.

description:
Yesterday I received a delivery the cashier told me it will take 45 minutes they came in 30 minutes I was amazed the driver was amazing I just had two give this place some love and give them a five star review
I have dealt with 

so much pizza stores come late this one is only one comes early. Finally decent Pizza store.
author: Murad A.

description:
Due to my extremely close proximity to this fine establishment I feel I'm more then Qualified to review. 

Pizza is splendid. No tom foolery 
                  Always fresh 
I Order for a pick up. one large cheese pizza for one.
 it's done in 11 mins. 


If your drunk on Polk street at 2:15 am  this is the place to be!! Seriously stop getting crepes and come show some love at Irving.
author: Jake F.

description:
Pizza is good. Rating largely reflects experience ordering through Eat24. 

Order submitted at 12:11am. 

Receipt shows server Mandez entered the order into Irving Pizza system at 12:51am. 

Order delivery arrived at 1:40am. 

This was my first experience ordering from Irving Pizza. An hour and a half from order to delivery is far beyond expectation set by other pizza places in the area. Reviewing the timestamp on the receipt it appears this may be related to not checking incoming orders in a timely manner. It's possible they were slammed at the time I ordered or they were understaffed tonight. A courtesy note to phone, email, or through Eat24 to confirm the delayed timing could have set expectation.

Reasonably timely delivery is critical with as many pizza options are available in the area. This was the high score in terms of how long I've ever waited for a pizza in the Sunset. I will be returning to other options that consistently turn around an order in under an hour.

Edit: Lowered my review from two-stars to one-star. On reading other reviews for Irving Pizza there are MANY stories of extremely late delivery on pizza. This confirms my experience wasn't a one time incident, it's systematic. 

Avoid is the recommendation I would give to a friend.
author: David G.

description: Disaster. I come here frequently due to open late-ish & close to my apartment convenience. Never again. Tonight was my last straw. Let me preface my experience with the fact that the regular guy that mans the register is a total rude a**hole. But ok, whatever, he works in the TL and deals with some stupid bull that I personally have seen transpire previously. Somewhat excusable. This time, however, I arrived 15 mins after my grubhub order stated it would be available. (It's often later than expected) Upon arrival, a different than usual guy (seemed like he could be an owner?) told me he didn't have my order. Hmm well that's interesting being that I have the confirmation email and notifications from the app. He proceeds to question why I used grubhub (my card is already attached. But also why are you asking this? Your company signed up with grubhub). At this point I had walked down to get my pizza but did not bring my card or cash, because I had already paid through grubhub. Didn't think I'd need it. He asks if I have the card #. My partner texts the card # to me. I wait 20 mins for him to make said pizza. Doesn't work. I just waited for a pizza I should have already received. 45 mins after my order was stated to be ready, I left, disgruntled, with no pizza in hand and I will never return to this wretched place ever again. No care for customers or mistakes or shitty pizza.
author: Luca T.

description: Not impressed whatsoever. The dough / crust tasted pre-made. If this place actually stayed true to its logo of being born in NYC that would be a fresh crust with fresh dough. The toppings tasted absolutely cheap. It just feels and tastes as though they phone this in day in and day out and hope that the drunks don't notice. With all the Great Pizza joints within just a few miles of this place they need to step up their game or get drummed out of town. Born in NYC? More like kicked out of NYC.
author: Brian J.

description: I know we ordered pizza super close to closing time, but you told us they could do the order. When we called to check on it, you said it was coming. A fucking hour later, we called and told us that it's not going to happen. You had so many chances to let us know that you could not complete the order heck, you could of told us that when we called to make the damn order!!! Fucking waste of time
author: Vivee C.

description:
Not in the greatest of locations but really the only reason you're coming here is for late night munchies after the bar scene. I added a 1/2 star cause they're open super late until 4 a.m. on Saturdays. When all the other pizza places close a lot earlier. For about $20.00, we got a medium 8 slice pizza with pepperoni/sausage with addition to garlic. The pizza took about 10-15 mins and the guy in the counter was very friendly. 

The toppings were plentiful and the crust was good. This seems like mainly take out type of place with only a few tables inside. Definitely good to cure your munchie cravings.
author: James H.

description:
Ordered a vegetarian pizza. They delivered meat loaded pizza. Called in and they apologized. Asked to issue a refund. They said a refund will be issued. 

Appreciate the honesty and good response regarding an innocent mistake.
author: Victor S.

description: My friends live near here and they suggested the garlic bread to eat as an appetizer. You would need to dig into the garlic to get the cloves and spread it on the bread. I have never had this type of garlic bread before and it was tasty! The pizza was also great. The delivery was fast as well!
author: Azamat A.

description:
I wish this review could be about the food... but sadly its is not...

The husband was coming home late from work, and I thought it would be great to order dinner ahead of time and have it delivered right when he got home. 

At 6:19pm I submitted my order through EAT24 for a 7:30pm delivery.  I did not select the ASAP order, as they were quoting 45-60 minutes and I did not want the pizza arriving to early and it being cold for when he got home. 

The order went through and was confirmed. Husband got home. No pizza.

I did the customary 15 minute grace period and then some. At 7:54pm I messaged EAT24 to see where my food was. At 7:59, EAT24 responded and said they were pulling up the order.  At 8:05 the EAT24 rep was trying to "get through the line" (I guess calling the restaurant). At 8:09 he informs me that "the rain has backed them up, and they will give me $5 off my order" (now 40 minutes late). I then inform them I would like to just cancel my order.  At 8:10pm the rep says "your driver will be arriving very soon, are you sure? I am just verifying for the restaurant". I said, no please cancel. At 8:12 he then says "restaurant give you free dinner. Approved refund and free food". I said no, we are headed out and that we were going to grab food. Please make sure the restaurant knows we do not want the food. 

So we leave... Just before I leave, I check google maps and it says it would only be a 13 minute drive from the restaurant (with traffic), so I know there is not traffic in the city tonight.

We drive cross town, pick up dinner, head home, and as we are pulling into the garage, a call comes through at 8:47pm.  We pick it up, thinking it might be the restaurant calling to apologize. But no, it is the delivery driver saying he is outside our building with our pizza. First of all, the directions on the order clearly stated to use our door buzzer to call so we could buzz him in, secondly, we had told them to cancel the order! And given now that it is 8:47 and google maps is saying it is only an 11 minute drive, they clearly had not even looked at our order until we contacted EAT24 and their line of "your driver is arriving very soon" at 8:10 was a complete LIE!!!

Oh well.. should have read the reviews... seems this happens often.
author: David P.

description: Pizza here is very good.....I frequently visit this place and this has very unique taste and I can its a best pizzeria near by.....
author: Bhandari C.

description: Great pizza. Fast delivery. I love that you can order by the slice, and they are huge. I did have a mixup with my order (salad sent sans dressing), but it was quickly resolved by both the restaurant and Eat24. I would definitely order again, but likely stick to pizza only. Added bonus: the pizza reheated pretty nicely as well.
author: Penny D.

description:
Seriously delicious drunk munchy pizza. Loacted right next to my crews regular bar Eddinburg Castle, Irving Pizza offers fresh (and sometimes not so fresh) slices for the drunken messes we become after too many shots and too many beers spilled down our nice blouses. 

I like how the pizza boy / cashier picks the fresh slices rather than the ones that have been sitting out for a while for my friends and me. The pizza is oily and hot and perfect for soaking up the booze and making you feel all warm and oily inside. Wait, what?

I'd order it sober or wasted, happy or depressed. Good stuff.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Honestly, the reason I'm doing a 5 star rating is because this is an honest pizza shop. What I mean by honest:
1) Open till 2:00 am on weekends. This is important! I work in a bar and a lot of people are always looking for pizza to soak up the booze I served them. Without a doubt these guys are open, reliable and have good staff.

2) Cheap. They are not going to swindle you with a $4.15 cheese slice that a lot of people do.

3) Delivery: If you're netflix and chillin and want BBQ wings, Mozz. Sticks and some garlic cheese fries.. without getting out of bed. These guys got you.
author: Alex G.

description: I ordered delivery here many times, was never great but this time I ordered the only desert they had on the menu which was the deep fried oreos, first piece my girlfriend ate had a metal piece of staple in it....like wtf
author: Eric L.

description: Great pizza good sauce and the people behind the counter are courteous! Will return and recommend to others.
author: Based O.

description: Love the fried oreos!! $10 for 12! Super yummy and friendly customer service :)
author: Seutatia F.

description:
Mediocre quality pizza with terrible customer service.

Brought the incorrect pizza and refused to correct it when I contacted them about it. I would strongly caution against them!
author: Brian J.

description:
The gist: Your typical but delicious pizza, fried oreos, great service.

Tried the veggie and the pesto slices. The veggie was alright, but the pesto was great. Gotta love pesto. We ordered fried oreos, which were not as good as the ones you get at the fair - too much dough and not very good flavor/consistency, but it was a deep-fried oreo dessert so it wasn't terrible, but who knew there was an art to fried oreos?

What bumped this experience up for me was the service taking place in this joint. There was a young gentleman running the joint, and he was just on top of it, in the zone. He was incredibly attentive to all the drunk customers, and he was really helpful and apologetic to a man in a wheelchair who wasn't helped as well by one of the cooks who tried to come out and cover the register. 

It made me remember all the dead-faced teenagers I'd bought food from throughout my life, and how much more awesome this guy was. As we left, he asked us how the oreos were. The truth was, they weren't that good, but I told him that they should include a dipping sauce. He said that he'd been thinking about that, too and was trying to figure out what kind of sauce to get. He clearly had an investment in this place and was trying to help improve that. I wish we all could be more like him at our jobs.

When you're needing a slice of pizza in this area, this is your spot over some of the others, simply due to this stellar customer service.
author: Ari F.

description:
I Ordered for Irving pizza and i was amazed how fast they came it was crazy i had to review them if i can give them 6 star I would but thats not all that made me go crazy the pizza just was amazing I love the Igor special was so good 
Everything That happened to me was good thank irving i love you
author: Neda A.

description: The pizza and wings were AMAZING. Great customer service and cozy atmosphere. Loved it!
author: Jessica H.

description: Disappointing much!? Oh yeah. Looks good on uber eats, but it's actually only ehhh. Not worth it.
author: Tim G.

description: I am giving 2 stars because my chicken sandwich was pretty good. Buttttt, I added cheese, jalapeños,  and bacon and NONE were on my sandwich. I also ordered a slice of pizza which was cold and  obviously old. Terrible. They mistakenly put the bacon in my salad, but it was uncooked turkey bacon!! Thoroughly dissapointed.
author: G S.

description: When you order a 14" pizza you get a 12" pizza in a 14" box. Great sauce but you should really make a 14" pizza when a customer orders one.
author: chad l.

description: This place, one of my favorite pizza spots in the city. So far had a great experience. Beside the delicious pizzas and appetizers, they provide a excellent customer service. Every time when I go to sf, I stop by Irving pizza for slice. Delivery, it's a whole different level. Probably the fastest delivery I've ever had. Great pizzas, awesome and friendly team, fastest delivery guys. More than a PIZZA PLACE.  I wish I could have such a pizza place in my neighborhood. I would rate this place more than a 5 stars, but this is only scale that yelp has. This place deserves 10 stars. Would recommend to everyone out there. I'm sure you gonna love it
author: Gabit S.

description: Ordered a pizza late a night (Around 12:30AM), delivery ran late because it was a busy night so it was all good. Pizza guy got there at around 2AM, said he forgot our pizza & never came back :( So we never got the pizza, delivery was late, but hopefully I will get the refund.
author: Laura Y.

description:
Great place, pizzas are very delicious and size of slices are very big. Workers very polite and friendly!
I know the owner as a very generous person!
Great place with convenient location to stop by and get some delicious pizzas!
Btw I love the pizza with ranch sauce and chicken  on it in "IRVING pizza"
author: Stan T.

description:
(4.5 stars, really)
I'm happy Yelp turned me to Irving Pizza tonight. Friendly service on the phone, the Hawaiian I ordered came even more quickly than the 40 min. they'd estimated, and they don't charge extra for delivery.

Pizza itself was excellent, with noticeably fresh ingredients. My only quibble was that after the first few bites, something seemed to be missing. I peeled back the ham, bacon, pineapple & cheese on my first slice without seeing a speck of red sauce. I called, and the phone guy, sounding truly horrified at the idea of such pizza malfeasance, insisted there must be sauce. Sure enough, on further investigation, he was right, the rest of the pizza did have a little. Way too little, but it was there, and what there was of it was delicious.

More sauce in the future, please, and all will be well with the world. I'll be ordering from Irving again, and predict they'll deserve the full 5 stars.
author: MJ M.

description: I started coming here about 3 months ago and the pizza was amazing i was going out with some friends late night and we came across this place pizza was hot and fresh and the staff there was amazing and they were so nice been coming here ever since.
author: Mohammad A.

description: I love this place and will give 5 star, they deserve it. Nice stuff clean inside and delivery is quick. I love their pizza with pepperoni and a Burger so delicious. Great job guys!!!
author: Adil Z.

description: I've been here probably six to eight times since moving to the area last year, and it has never disappointed. Won't give the rundown, since others have done so ad nauseam, but suffice to say that the food is terrific. I'm especially fond of the pepperonis, which are thick and extremely flavorful. It's impossible to not love this place!!!
author: Gauhar K.

description: Best store in San Francisco closest to New York by for now I understand why they say born in New York and raised in San Francisco Best staff ever like family
author: Mustafa A.

description: I ordered from here at 11:42 and I am still waiting for food at 1:15, very disappointing, every time I call they tell me it just left and should be delivered shortly. Yet I'm still waiting
author: Lauren F.

description: This place has the worst customer service! They canceled my order without having the delivery person ever knock on my door. When I called to figure out what happened, the person was so rude and wouldn't even tell me his name because he said "I don't feel comfortable giving my name I just work Here and answer the phone". This is unacceptable and ridiculous for take out. I don't order here ever again! I can't comment on the food because I didn't receive it!
author: Brent T.

description:
I have been going to Irving Pizza for several years. The owner and staff are always friendly and will to help with unusual orders. My father is also writing a review because of their concern for the neighborhood and GREAT PIZZA:) Make sure to try the pesto!

Markus H
author: Markus H.

description:
This hole in the wall pizza joint was okay.  We came here late on a weekend to order some slices since we were a bit hungry. 

I had a combination slice which was huge.  There was a lot of people inside, so we had to wait approximately 15 minutes for the new pizza to come out.  Oh well... who cares if it's kinda cold outside and our tummy's were filled with alcohol.  Boy, the pizza tastes really good after a night of drinking beer. 

The fellas behind the counter were pretty cool.  The dining area was a huge mess with trash and plates everywhere!  I think somebody needs to clean up instead of just standing around behind the counter.  Who in their right minds wants to sit on a dirty bench?  

Oh well. Typical pizza joint on every corner.
author: ED L.

description:
Whenever I've had enough of my clean eating plans and want to cheat, I always default to ordering a cheese pizza from Irving. Sometimes when I'm feeling extra naughty, I'll even get the deep-fried oreos (and spend the next three days feeling guilty about it). I have so many good memories of ordering from here when everything else was closed. Without exception, my pizza have always arrived on time, and the delivery guys have always been polite. The pizza itself is tasty and well-cooked. It's pizza, what more is there to say about it? I like the tomato sauce they use, and you can also customize a pizza. 

Irving is my guilty pleasure, and I always suggest it when me and friends are hungry and want something delicious and inexpensive.
author: Vilde E.

description:
I had to review this place and give it some love, since it seems to be getting mixed reviews. It deserves 5 stars because it's the best slice you can get in the Tenderloin-Nob Hill area. Trust me on this one. It's my go-to place for post-drinking slices.

The crust is thin and New York-style. It's really quite good. More than serviceable. I'd say it's almost on par with the famous Tony's in North Beach. So, if you like that kind of pizza, you should like this, too. If you're into overly thick, bready pizza like they have at some of the other places around here, this might not be your thing.
author: Walter L.

description: Ordered a bacon cheeseburger and deep fried oreos. It was hella  good. Would be 5 stars but they didn't put any bacon in my burger ) : I was at work so I really didn't have time to go back and complain about it.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
I barely remember this place as it came on the tail end of a great bar hoppin' trip through the area, but definitely recall the pizza as being a great nightcap. The owners must love all the hungry drunkards that stumble through the door... The place is kinda small but has a very high ceiling. 

Anyways, the pizza is fine, so next time you're in the area and possibly tipsy, check this place out.
author: John B.

description:
Hello Hamza,
This happened last Friday around 10:50 AM. And like I said, I didn't see a sign that said open or close, I just saw the door open somebody standing behind the counter and I thought it was okay to order pizza. You see I drive for a Uber and a lot of us drivers are always looking for a good place to hang out and have a slice of pizza instead of going all the way to North Beach. The place is clean considering being in the area that it's in. The guy that works there had the TV on blast but hey, good pizza and a noisy joint sometimes has a cool vibe to it. I'm not sure if I upset him because I didn't want the old pizza, I wanted  the one that was fresh, right next to the old one lol. And believe me sometimes old pizza reheated does taste good but, that early in the afternoon I wanted something fresh. I'm not looking for anything free however, good customer service goes a long ways. You can have the most crappy food but, if you got good service, people will still go there. thank you again for reaching out to me.
Best of luck!
Jim
author: Jim W.

description: Super fast delivery for a Saturday night ! Way faster than the 45 min they said . Pizza n wings were pretty damn good .
author: Valerie P.

description:
Irving is the best pizza in the Tenderloin, without a doubt.

Really nice staff, downright friendly and helpful. Slices are fantastic, I have yet to be disappointed.

The dough/crust is standout. They don't charge for a side of ranch. Open late.

Thank you Irving pizza, great work on the remodel. Keep the ranch FREEEEEE.
author: Carson L.

description: I ordered delivery through grub hub last night, and was so disappointed. It took 75 min for french fried, one slice of pizza, deep fried Oreos and a can of soda. The only warm thing was the garlic fries, which were not evenly fried and the "garlic" was just a small scoop (maybe like a teaspoons worth) of not very fresh pre diced garlic that was just sitting on the corner of the box. SO disappointing. I paid an extra $2 for a teaspoon of unfresh garlic. Plus the pizza was cold, with essentially VERY little cheese under the toppings (which were minimal). And the fried Oreos were even colder, some over fried and some under. It's just a bummer because when I lived in the sunset I used to order from the Irving location almost weekly, and the food always arrived hot, on time or early, the pizza toppings were always hooked up and they had great customer service. I will never order from this location again, no matter how bad I'm craving deep fried Oreos lol. 0/10 would not recommend.
author: Evelyn M.

description:
Had a delivery for two..meatball sandwich and the philly NO Hangover..having a cold, I thought the philly would help.  It did. Meatball for husband and he said it was very good and not messy.
Pizzas are good to..We have different tastes so we each get one slice of our favorite
author: Judy K.

description: This place is amazing the staff the cooks they're all kick ass people. Great pizza and the chicken strips and fries are enough to feed 2. The best pizza spot in the Tenderloin hands down
author: Jim F.

description: This pizza joint is in a 'decent' part of town, but worth the trip!!! Everyone that works there is soooo nice and helpful!!!! I LOVE their chicken pesto pizza while my husband is in LOVE with their pepperoni pizza!!!! Wish they had one in AZ!!!! We would order from them every week!!!
author: Jessie C.

description: This isn't the best pizza on earth, but it's good and really welcome after spending a few hours at one of the nearby bars and needing decent sustenance to soak up some of that alcohol. A wide variety of slices are almost always available right away, the appetizers are tasty and the prices are good. Personally, I like to keep it basic with the pepperoni but the combo and pesto pizzas are good too. The servers are also friendly and accommodating to the masses of intoxicated customers that pour in after midnight.
author: Melissa T.

description: A great place to grab a burger, pizza or a salad.  My new back-up lunch place for when I forget to bring mine, or when i purposefully forget.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Good for a quick bite to hold you over until you can eat something else. Had a slice of the Pesto feta, which was good but not at Pieces in midtown Sacramento's level of deliciousness.

We had to wait for our pizza about 20 mins when they promised only 10 minutes. Seating is very limited and cramped.
author: Sarah H.

description: Nasty and disgusting!! This is by far the worst food I have ever tried, do not waste your money do not eat here  is not worth it.
author: Karla P.

description:
Not the best, but good for satiating late night hunger pangs.  Slices are decently priced for what it is.  

If you like garlic.... there's a chicken garlic one, when freshly made is pretty amazing.
author: CatwomanRoar M.

description: I love to get this place's pizza when I'm in the neighborhood so I thought they were deserving a chance on Eat24. Let me note that Eat24 is usually terrible but when I needed them in an emergency last time, they weren't too bad. Today, I ordered French fries, chicken strips, and the deep fried Oreos. I was very suprised about how warm the food was since I live by 1st street. Let me tell you, this was the best eat24 order but it was also the farthest place Ive ever ordered from. I've ordered from places very close only to have (literally) rotten, inedible food delivered to me. The chicken strips could be a lot better, to be honest. I never saw them cooked this way so I wonder if it's intentional or if they just don't know how to cook chicken strips. The rest of the food was pretty good. The fries are excellent and big. I wish they would've added the melted cheese I asked for but they're definitely worth getting. The Oreos are even better than I expected. It's a good thing they just give you 4! They are pretty oily so I recommend blotting them with a paper towel. I rate this place a 4 here but as far as Eat24 is concerned I rate them a 5. Eat24 is obnoxiously terrible but if you're in a pinch and have credit from prior orders, go with this place. The disappointment will be minimal.
author: Jackie K.

description:
We have so much love for Irving Pizza. It's everything a solid pizza joint is supposed to be. Those of you who are coming here and expecting like, gourmet and high-end food are frankly just being whiny and spoiled. This is a place that's open until 2am, hot and almost always fresh. You can't complain about that! 

Pizza is excellent, very customizable. I'm in love with the crust. It's obviously house made and cooked proper (at high temps) so that it comes out really rustic, rather than plastic-y tasting and so uniformly shaped that it's obviously frozen, like it can at other places. A+. 

Not feelin' pizza? Go for a philly cheese steak sandwich. They're soooo bomb. Meat is super tasty, and toppings are everything you'd expect them to be. I don't like their fries at all, too fluffy and not crispy enough for me, but fries are one of the things I get picky about in life. No worries, though, 'cause I can just get a side salad instead. 

Finally, the ranch dressing is worth noting. I'm from the South, where we tend to put ranch on everything, so I always get some on the side to dip my pizza in. Ranch is another thing I can get picky about, but I could eat theirs everyday. It's that good. Not sure if it's house made or not, but it's delicious. 

All in all, Irving Pizza holds a special place in my heart. No complaints, and until they give me a reason not to, I'm a loyal customer.
author: Ashley-Jayne O.

description:
Being bothered.

Not by the Tenderloin. Always colorful and interesting.

But by my disregard for yelping this location a few years back: http://www.yelp.com/biz/irving-pizza-san-francisco#hrid:ZSE8O_bJsbBmTtdR7PKdeA

Stopped in to remedy this overnight. Friendly staff served a $3 reheated cheese slice no better or worse than many other spots around town. It was good and gone.

Perhaps you'll bother giving a fourth star if the sandwiches are just as good as the aforementioned Sunset location.
author: Jason B.

description:
I don't know why I keep coming here. Actually, I do - it's en route from Van Ness to my apartment, and if it's late at night and I've just gotten off the bus on my way home and I'm hungry, it has fries. But that's honestly the best thing I can say about it.

1. Slowest service known to mankind. It shouldn't be a fifteen minute wait for a little box of French fries, but it is. Every. Single. Time. They're not even that busy. (Joke's on me for continuing to go there expecting things will be different, but, hey, I get hungry.)
2. Quality is hit-or-miss. Sometimes delicious and satisfying, sometimes scorched and nasty.
3. Every crackhead in the Tenderloin likes to hang around outside.

It's conveniently located and open late, but that's it.
author: Julia K.

description: This is my go to pizza order place in SF for a couple years now and it has ALWAYS been early/right on time and delicious!
author: Gen F.

description:
I've given this place so many opportunities to impress me over the years, But it just doesn't cut it. 

Super thin slices, sparse cheese and even less toppings. Your typical bland and soggy slice lives here. 


Tried other menu items like Cesar salad, chicken parm... That doesn't cut it either. This place is only surviving because of unsuspecting drunk hipsters trying to eat something while heading home. 


I suggest walking down to Milan pizza.
author: sam c.

description:
This is a review of deliver from Irving Pizza,

Average philly cheesesteak (for a pizza place - not for a dedicated cheesesteak place), average steak fries, a couple of decent slices of pizza. for delivery,  I would use them again. prices were pretty good too.

Delivery was prompt, professional, and polite.
author: Mark D.

description: This is my go to pizza place! The pizza is dankity dank, decently priced and the staff is friendly. Delivery is usually quick also
author: Sasha P.

description:
I have eaten ALOT of pizza in this city and this is by far one of my faves, and I randomly found it by using eat24.com

The first time we ordered AMAZING, then the 2nd time it came all wrong. Trust me Pepperoni being mixed up with pineapple can really kill a pie! But as soon as I called they were very apologetic and offered to give us a $20 credit on out next order to make up for it. 

We ordered again last night and they kept their word and were thankful that we were giving them a second chance, our total was $1.57 after our credit and the pizza and wings got their within 25 mins on a Saturday night! 

Thanks again! Nom!
author: Alicia K.

description:
what i ordered.... slice of pepperoni 

pizza was ok..........typical for a hole in a wall pizza joint

ambiance... bad (dirty and get ready to get mugged outside)
service... bad (not even a smile, just a stare)
cost... $- (inexpensive)
author: Gors P.

description:
Used to give this place great reviews, but curbside manner of delivery and poor standards have really dropped the quality of this establishment which started off in the Sunset, where I used to live. 
They are open late and deliver late, so coming home and hungry, just make sure to call in your order instead of using the computer, because there is some sort of communication problem with time delay.
Wide variety of menu.
author: Luis M.

description:
I like the other Irving Pizza location I'm familiar with, the one on Irving and 19th Avenue, so I decided to try this one for lunch one day at work, ordering delivery through Grubhub. 

The order took quite a long time, over and hour on a Sunday afternoon. Something forgivable in general but, upon delivery, the driver informed me that he'd given my order of fries to another customer by mistake. Frustrating, but he was genial and offered to take the fries off my order or come back and redeliver them. I asked him to bring the order of fries and proceeded to go about my lunch.

I had ordered two salads, one greek with a side of italian, adding mushrooms, and the other a chef salad with a side of ranch and no olives. The greek salad was fine, but the chef salad was backwards as all get out. Olives everywhere, no mozzarella cheese when that's explicitly listed as a topping, mushrooms that aren't supposed to be there or listed as a chef salad topping, and italian dressing instead of ranch.

Ravenous, I dejectedly picked at the salad for a bit, then closed it back up. I called Irving Pizza and, after an excruciatingly long explanation of how they got the order wrong (and how I could prove it since it was written down), they offered me the correct salad or a credit. I was firm in asking for a refund and needed them to call Grubhub (I was at work, remember?). He said they might need to talk to me (not sure why, other restaurants make adjustments that charge me all the time, do they think I'd be angry at charges taken off my bill?) and that was that.

A few minutes later, the delivery driver arrived with the fries I had ordered. I didn't tell him about the salad screw up, I figured it wasn't his fault and he had given effort to fix his mistake. I probably should have let him know though, as in the middle of eating the french fries I get a call from Grubhub asking me why I didn't return the salad. I told them I threw it away because the restaurant never asked for it back (truth, and I'm not sure what they would want with it anyway) and was adamant about getting a refund. They relented and I could finally go about my day.

In short, this Irving Pizza completely botched my order and, in concert with Grubhub, made very poor efforts to ameliorate their errors. I'm very disappointed in both businesses and surprised I had to be so forceful to get them to treat me like a valuable customer.
author: Josh S.

description:
This place is terrible. My friend and I had a late night craving for philly cheesesteak. She made me a deal that if I fly, she'll buy.

The pictures on this website DO NOT at all look like the crap we got, the pictures actually look bomb.com. Anyway, we phoned in the order and the guy said it would take 20 minutes tops (i figured they must be busy with all the drunks leaving the clubs at this hour since it was pretty late). I gave them an extra 5 minutes just in case. 

I walked in and there was no one in this place. The guy at the counter rudely asked what I was there for and I told him that I placed a phone order. He never confirmed or denied getting a phone order and basically just took my order on the spot. 

I sat there patiently waiting basically people watching because everyone else seemed to be ordering and getting their food within 5 minutes. I don't understand how these dumba$$es took my phone order and still have not even made it. I had another guy come out from the back and ask what I ordered again.

Anyway... what was supposed to be a 20 minute wait turned into nearly an hour wait, I'm not even exaggerating. When I asked for some ranch he had to go ask the manager if I could have some. I've never had such terrible customer service in my life and the food was not good at all. Avoid this place like the plague!
author: Chris R.

description: Slow service.  Dirty store front. Pizza was a little worse than I expected even given these circumstances.
author: Heidi M.

description: Awesome tasting pizza. Open late nights.  I definitely will be coming back. My gf who is a vegetarian was able to enjoy a vegetarian pesto pizza. Friendly, fast service. Damn, I'm craving it now
author: Erick E.

description: You know, it's not bad pizza. They make the dough fresh, always a few pies ready to order by the slice, staff is friendly, and there's usually a soccer game on the TV. But it's still a basic street pizza place, last time I was there the crust was undercooked and doughey, condiments were whatever happened to be on the counter, and best you sop it off with a pile of napkins before eating. I wouldn't go out of my way to order this, but if you need a slice and you're on the block by all means.
author: Gil S.

description: I like the pizza---tastes wonderful! But NOW y'all are skimping on the toppings.  Come on now....if you need to tack on a quarter or whatever to the $1 per topping price, THEN DO SO, but PLEASE don't deliver a pizza with barely nothing on it! When I order five toppings, I don't want to see the sauce or crust, just saying....step it up Irving!
author: James E.

description:
I order delivery from this location frequently, and I'm not sure why I still do. My first two pizzas were AMAZING and it has consistently gone downhill from there. The toppings have become fewer and fewer - even when I order and pay for extra. The delivery times are very inconsistent, even when ordered during a slow time of day. I've received delivery on two separate occasions where the pizza has been barely above room temperature.

The grossest thing? I ordered bacon on my salad and they put RAW STRIPS OF BACON ON MY SALAD. Are you kidding me?
author: Betsey K.

description: Order from these guys a lot, love any of their pizzas with BBQ sauce. Delivery's always quick, and they usually walk up to my place which is cool. Another plus: the toppings are always quality, and they definitely don't skimp! Would recommend.
author: Royale C.

description: This is the absolute shittiest restaurant that I know of! I used eat24.com to order from there, and at the time I had no cell phone reception unfortunately. According to the restaurant, the driver arrived, left, and came back. I was finally able to call them eventually. When the driver came back, I made a point to meet him and explain my situation, but I was instead directed a flurry of obscene language and slurs for several minutes. Finally I told the driver to fuck off and reported it to eat24. Upon inspection of my order, the food was all cold, and portions of the order were missing. Eat24 did there best to resolve the issue, but later that night one of my coworkers placed an order to Irving Pizza and he was given the same rude treatment by the restaurant manager over the phone. He received his food over two hours later, which was unfit to eat, so he threw it away. The manager of the restaurant did not seem concerned with the issue, in fact he was extremely rude over the phone. I hope Irving Pizza is shut down forever. Do not eat here!
author: Matt F.

description:
Irving Pizza on Geary suxs. Attempted to order a pizza through Eat24 last night at 10pm kept calling Eat24 and the restaurant and was told at 1 am that it was not coming they lost our order. Are you serious. Dreadful service, no remorse. Stay away from this place and reprimand Eat24 for supporting this place! Zero Zero Zero Zero Zero Zero Zero Zero Zero Zero Stars!!!!

Update and Correction!

Eat24 gave me a call and Irving Pizza made good on their delivery to me. I want to say thank you Eat24 and irving Pizza. The actual pizza was tasty, but after the delivery experience I may have to go to my local Escape from NY hotspot.
author: Adrienne H.

description: The pizza by the side selection is good: they had the basic cheese, pepperoni, and supreme, but also a veggie-pesto, Hawaiian, and mushroom. The service however was appalling, even for an order at the counter pizza by the slice place. Maybe after the world cup ends the cashier will not need to be asked for the pizza that's already paid for twice before it's then over cooked, forgotten about one more time and delivered.
author: Brian K.

description: Irving Pizza is a bit out of my way, but me and my family simply love their pizza. The staff seem to genuinely care about treating customers more like family. This is truly pizza made with pride and love.
author: David V.

description: I am giving this a three but with a note:  I was out late drinking late pre-NFC Championship game.  Coming from NY and now living in LA it was nice to stumble upon a pizza joint that sells by the slice and reminded me of home.  Pizza was ok...but this place is a dive and who knows...if I went back there again sober it might be a different story.  Kind of like eating White Castles for the first time in a normal state of mind.  Just ain't the same!!!!
author: Kim H.

description: I order from Irving pizza quite a lot. I love that they give you the choice between tomato, pesto or ranch sauce for every pizza you order. The ranch ones are absolutely amazing! Yes, sometimes they mess up your order, but whenever it happens, they are always ready to make it up to you. Oh and they have friendly staff too!
author: Christelle V.

description: I received prompt and polite delivery on a Thursday evening. Delivery minimum is only ten bucks. Food could have been hotter but it was solid. Big salad, big sandwich, plenty of under-seasoned steak fries (and salt and ketchup packets). Cannot speak for the pizza of it's namesake, but don't be too scared to give this place a try...
author: Libra J.

description:
Has anyone ever really been here... sober?

I definitely have not and I never tend to even remember it is here unless I find myself knee deep in the throws of the Tenderloin dancing in the street and cracking myself up. But, I will say, for those times, Irving is the bomb diggity duck and I have many a saved morning owed to a tasty slice here at around 1:48am.

So thanks Irving, serving drunk people suits you well.
author: Stephy S.

description:
Dear Irving Pizza, 

Your pizza is definitely worthy of 5 stars! So, worthy that my bf who's been on "diet mode" for the past week to save his tummy for Thanksgiving Day pig out next week agreed to have a slice last night. But, let me tell you why I'm giving your Geary Blvd. location 2 stars. 

We were there last night around 7 PM to grab a quick bite to eat. While waiting in line, there was an uncut cheese pizza sitting on the counter that was clearly fresh out the oven. After your employee gave a customer back his change, he used his BARE HANDS to hold the crust (no, he did NOT wash them) and began to slice the cheese pizza. After proceeding to the next customer and giving him his change, he repeated the process and continued to slice the pizza with his bare hands again. This made my stomach churn as I'm sure he did that with the other pizzas. 

Although I was thoroughly disgusted, I have to say my bf loves your pizza so much that he ate his entire cheese pizza slice including the crust (yes, from the one that was being cut). So, I guess your pizza is that good... 

Management--I know we're all trying to cut cost these days, but can you PLEASE: 

1) Buy (or re-buy) gloves for your employees 
2) Train (or re-train) your employees on how to use them 

Thank you!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
We came here last night after some drinking and partying.  We were walking up Geary towards Van Ness, and I was saying, "Wouldn't it be great if there was some pizza here to save us?"  And lo and behold, Irving Pizza appears!  YAY!  I got super excited and rushed in.  

Unfortunately, the excitement died right there and then.  

PIZZA FTW:
+ Great location after hitting some bars! 
+ Good, fast service.  We got our slices after like 3 minutes.
+ They take card, which I'm always so thankful for, because I never carry around any cash. 

PIZZA WTF:
- IT TASTES REALLY BAD.  
- IT TASTES REALLY SALTY.
- IT'S NOT EVEN GOOD WHEN DRUNK.
- I HAD LOW EXPECTATIONS, AND EVEN THOSE WEREN'T MET!

I guess I was most disappointed because when you're not expecting much from a slice of pizza and you're just eating it because it's, well, pizza, then it shouldn't disappoint, right?

WRONG.  

I guess when there's not too much else around, this'll do.  

Yeah.  This'll do. Even if TASTE = NOT GOOD.
author: Vivian C.

description: I called to order pizza from Irving Pizza it was really good and the best thing about Irving Pizza there delivered was fast and it was fresh. I really recommend it.
author: Jessica J.

description:
To be honest I haven't found a better place to grab a slice at 2 am in my drunken hot mess-self. These guys are always nice. They help me count my change when I dump my bag on the counter and try to find exact change. They dont mind if I change my mind of what kind of pizza I want 4 minutes after ordering.

And the pizza. It's legit. Drunk or sober this place hands down knows pizza. 1 slice fills you up!

nice guys. cheap pizza. yummy slices. I'm lovin it!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Best veggie slice in the TL! The crust is perfecto. And they always have hot sauce options. [: 
The people that work there definitely aren't the friendliest though. But buzzin' at 2am, you can't go wrong. Been here wayyy too many times!
author: Sarah S.

description: The pizza is better than the service. Many a time has my order been wrong, but I still call them because they make pizzas that aren't found anywhere else in the city. (at least not that I've found) just don't order a Caesar salad unless you like house salad. lol
author: Tanith N.

description:
I was in town for a conference and wanted to order dinner in (not room service).  This place had appeared to have good reviews on the site I used, but my experience was that the pizza was supremely mediocre - I ended up eating the topping off the top because the crust was so icky doughy.  And the pizza was almost cold by the time it arrives (over an hour after I ordered it).  The salad was better - the veggies were fresh.  But my bill for the small pizza and salad, plus tip, was over $27.   

I definitely would not order from this place again.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
Meh.
 
Ambiance: None. I don't think they can even spell this word.
Foodie likeability: The pizza is okay but the sandwiches are TINY and expensive.
Prices: Very very cheap
Drunk Tolerance: Very high.  They put up with all sort of drunken losers that wander in from the gutter so mad props to them.

However: Not only did he forget I was sitting there waiting for my sandwich, he forgot my drink. I waited 20 minutes for a sandwich, watched a line of drunk people harass the poor guy behind the counter, get harassed by said drunk people. 
Tiny tiny sandwich for $6.50 and I couldn't even get his attention for my soda so I gave up. Boo! Boo!

Okay DISCLAIMER: Not like the one in the Sunset. Much much different from the one in the Sunset.
author: Jessica K.

description: When you just got kicked out of Edinburgh castle next door, you can always hit this place up. They actually have a sick burger, it's surprisingly good. Decent prices, fast service. What more do you want from a pizza spot.
author: Harry M.

description:
I had to eat here cause I grew up in Irving, Tx and it was totally worth it. :D

It's not too greesy and the sauce has just the right flavour.
author: Monica C.

description:
Thank you for being open when I got to your establishment!

I was faded!

I was hungry!

I had some wasted friends with me!

We were hungry!

So all of us grabbed a slice or two of pizza here and it sobered us up and was quite delicious doing so!  

Thanks!
author: Limzer L.

description:
Silly me, I thought this was the same Irving pizza that was in the sunset!! NOPE, not even close! 

I just ordered from here because I was so excited that they deliver to my address and since I am in the middle of packing for my trip, doing laundry, etc, I thought it would be a great easy meal to order. I ordered cheese slices (one for tonight, one for lunch tomorrow), garlic fries, and 3 sides of ranch. It was awful! 

One of the slices of pizza was old and was attempted to be revived by throwing fresh cheese on it before reheating it...Didn't work! 

The fries were definitely microwaved and you and I both know that is never a good choice! Also, they were not garlic fries. They were a container of steak fries with a tablespoon of garlic thrown in the middle. I could have done that! 

Also, I ordered 3 ranch and guess how many came with my order. That is correct, ZERO! 

Definitely do not order the garlic fries and do not order this as a delivery!! Totally not worth the 15 dollars! Nasty!
author: M M.

description:
I live right near Polk and Geary, so there are a lot of choices for late night pizza by the slice in my hood, but Irving Pizza is my favorite. 

The pizza is always tasty and they usually have a few good selections on hand. I usually get plain cheese, but their pesto veggie is also really good.
author: Christy Z.

description:
I wouldn't go anywhere else to get a slice if I was in the downtown area. Period. This is the best quality on a budget pizza joint in the area, unless you're into the fake type of bologna peperoni they serve at places like Cybelles (just sayin). The ranch is pretty good too, not too mayo-ish, not too thick, but if you're hoppin out from the bar next door, it won't even matter; Pizzas good for soaking up alcohol.

Favorite slice: Jalapenos + Pineapple ( Believe me, it's good.)

The service is fairly friendly but the crowd is dicey at best; being next door to a marijuana dispensary, Edingburgh Castle (pub), bus stop, oh and not to mention it's near the corner of Geary and Larkin (bum central), so if you're not familiar with the TL, best have your wits about you (it's really more gritty than it is "dangerous"). 

Delivery is pretty fast and reliable too.
author: Ed D.

description:
I used to frequent the original store in the sunset whenever I had late night cravings, but the food at both spots is not bad.  The pizzas are usually chock full of toppings and are a hearty size.  The fried food?  well, it's fried food and that stuff always tastes good.  

If you need a quick bite drop in and grab a slice or head here to satisfy that late night craving after clubbing.
author: Aaron W.

description:
I live a block away so I go here all the time. I love their pizza, haven't tried anything else.

But, as others have indicated, their service is pretty abysmal, and I've only gotten slices to go. The guys are absent-minded, to say the least. One guy screws up so much  that my friends and I have started to take bets as to how many mistakes he'll make when we go. He ALWAYS hands you a slice that isn't yours while he watches TV and/or forgets about slices warming up for so long to the point that when it's him, I just ask him not to warm them up.
author: Phatalie J.

description: Pretty good slice. A little too doughy for my likes, but a staple after a night of dancing & illing at the Edinburgh Castle.
author: Quentin J.

description: This place is horrible. You'd think it would help that I'd been drinking at Edinburgh Castle but I will remember to not ever come back here no matter how much I've had to drink.
author: Justin S.

description:
I order from Irving's almost every single day, and believe it or not whenever i am out of San Francisco they are one of the top things i miss in this city!
I really recommend it to everyone, 4 stars because delivery time might be a bit slow due to high demand :)
author: Amir E.

description: Went there around 1AM, only one person working behind counter as cashier, taking phone orders and heating up slices. He forgot about my friends & mine pizza slices as he wasn't multi-tasking very effectively. So after 5-6 minutes of reheating slices he finally takes them out and they were way over-cooked. He sticks 'em on one paper plate like nothing's wrong. Asked to have new slices and guy had an attitude problem about it, stating he didn't over-cook them at all (nearly black on the bottom) and has been cooking slices like this for 20-something years. Yeah, it shows! No apologies for making us wait so long either. I've never been to this pizza joint, I usually ALWAYS go to Milan up the street (who are less pricey and WAY more friendly plus their pizza tastes better) but my friend insisted we go there and try a new place. BIG mistake, lesson learned. 1.5 stars.
author: John D.

description: Most crisp and fluffy pizza I've had in the City. I consider myself a pizza connoisseur and this is a pizza (when fresh) is definitely worth buying!
author: Brian P.

description: hey, this pizza is pretty good, and then you can bring it into edinburgh next door.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
As with many culinary staples in San Francisco,  those who review Pizza joints can be subjective, especially after a one-time visit and a single experience. They tend to add dimension to yelp reviews, but can be difficult and sometimes useless in gauging the quality of business.

Irving Pizza on Geary is not THE FRACKING BEST PIZZA YOU'VE EVER HAD. Irving Pizza on Geary is also not THE WORST  PIZZA WITH THE WORST SERVICE IN THE WORLD F*CK THESE FOOLS I'M NEVER GOING BACK.

Irving Pizza IS an reliable, well-priced, tasty little spot in the heart of the tenderloin. They advertise their NYC influences, yet embrace a definitive west coast approach. No deep-dish specialties unless requested, no beer, limited seating and fast service, especially if you take the time to say "hello" and "thank you" to those serving you. 

Baked by the pie, slices will be rebaked if ordered off the street. Standard for most joints, but fresh pies come out often, so asking when a hot one's coming up and waiting could be your best bet.

Irving's niche seems to be servicing late-night stumblers and delivery lovers. I've fallen into both categories many, many times and have never been let down. Prompt arrival every delivery time. Effective yumminess on every stumble.

On their Pizza: hot, fresh, cheesy, greasy, saucy glory. Sweet doughy crust that sags with toppings and puffs up on the outer ring. Excellent foldover slices with TONS of customizable options and dedicated specials. Drool-inducing warm sexual foodage dripping with juice and grease and hot love as only SF can deliver. 

I also recommend the wings. They're fried in a spiced batter, not just nuked and covered in cold sauce as many other places tend to try and pass as a buffalo wings. My favorite local wings by far.

A word on freshness: I've burnt the hell out of myself many times digging too eagerly into a delivery slice. If that aint hot and fresh, than to hell with hot and fresh. 

They're reachable by GrubHub, Eat24hrs, Phone and iPhone. 

Learn to Love, and Love to Learn.
author: Conor S.

description: the pepperoni pizza is great - the pepperoni is a little charred and it curls up.  the buffalo wings are also tasty - it had panko like breading and spicy.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I order delivery from them 3-5 times a week. Its a  problem.
Pizza is good.
Philly Cheese steak is amazing (ask for extra cheese)
Chicken wings are awesome -not spicy or saucy, but awesome.
Poppers are amazing!!
Cheese stix are great!

All the guys that work there are really sweet.
One of the best late night, drunken food places.

Now, if i was sober and craving an amazing pizza, i would prob order from Orgasmica or something much better. But irving sells by the slice, and will custom slices for you.
author: Alyjaa S.

description: Yummy! When it is late at night and you are out with friend and you get the munchies, nothing hits the spot like a slice of yummy pizza. Got that here. The pizza was delicious perhaps a little too greasy but I should not complain. I am just glad that you can get decent food at 12 at night. It was also interesting trying to figure out what language the waiter was speaking to his friends.
author: Sunil R.

description: Irving pizza is one of those few places I like to frequent whether I'm drunk or not. huge slice of combo pizza for $4. hell yes.
author: Alyssa L.

description: Greasy! But they are open late... way too greasy for me though even when drunk...
author: Gene X.

description:
At 6:55PM I had placed my order through Grubhub. As usual, an e-mail confirmation, and two text messages were sent to keep me in track of the ETA. 7:40PM - 7:50PM, it said. Silly to take that long for a burger and fries. But as with my (pleasanter) experiences with Grubhub orders, especially if it's a smaller order, and the restaurant closer to my apartment, more often than not, the wait is shorter. Sillier too, perhaps for me, that I didn't just pick up the order, since they're only a couple of blocks away. But it's cold out, and I'm exhausted, and all I really want to do is pig out on some grease slop. So much so I felt warped in fevered delirium, and thinking generously, that when my order comes, I've got a big fat tip to whoever brings my food. 7:40PM came and went. I'm growing more impatient. And then 7:50PM: by now I'm chain-smoking in hopes of alleviating the hunger, and the simmering temper that arises from a combination of hunger, work exhaustion, tardiness of others, and incompetence.

Roommie and I work very early hours, scholarly in temperament, and have a quiet understanding between us that after a certain time in the evening, after our long hours at work (and then some more work at home!), that we are going to keep the apartment (at least on the weekdays), as quiet as a tomb. I've gotten so accustomed to these weekdays that the cellphone ring, the chirp of a text message, the neighbors' television, and mooks out on the street will drive me willy-nilly to distraction. Especially that damned, thunderous doorbell of ours! And so, needless to say, I requested that the delivery person skip that and call my phone instead. But no call. When I washed my hands in the bathroom, could I have missed that call? Nope. Not on my phone. When I had a smoke? Oh yeah, I brought my phone with me. Nope. No calls. 

I called. Initially to see if they were even open. Maybe Grubhub was mistaken of their hours, and mistook taking my order. Nope. Open. I inquired of my order. Yes, they know all about it. The employee even sounded off accusingly that I had not been picking up the phone when they tried! NOPE. "I'd like to cancel that order," I sternly said. "Well, we called and called..." he blubbered, and carried on confirming my address, and then phone number. Nope. No calls. "I'd like to cancel that order, please," I gravely repeated. They've been dialing the wrong number, he explained repentantly, to which a vehement "Your mistake" was my reply. "I'd like to cancel that order please." I suppose he was nice enough to offer to bring the food back-- gratis. Nope. MY APPETITE HAS BEEN RUINED! And... What dumb business practice is that? Do they randomly give food away as consolation for a measly complaint and cancellation? Besides, after my ill-treatment of them... the possibilities of their retaliation I don't care to speculate. Nope.
author: Rho-p O.

description: I used to like Irving, it was pretty decent pizza that was reasonably priced. But after last night, trying to order a pizza for delivery, I received the rudest customer service, if you can even call it that. The guy made me feel like I was an inconvenience. I don't know how any business expects to keep running when they treat their customers like crap. Here's a tip, hire better people.
author: Sophie P.

description: Some of the better slices in the tenderloin..chicken parm sandwiches are pretty good
author: Don E. D.

description:
I used to eat here when I was drunk (like most other reviewers), which led to eating here when I was sober, but that just infuriated me. 

The pizza sucks. Let's get that clear. Salty, greasy, nasty. That's not why I gave this place 1 star. The service BLOWS! Most of the time the guy behind the counter is watching some stupid show on the WB or something. I once ordered a slice of pepperoni and it took 10 minutes for him to even put the slice into the oven to reheat it... and it was because the instant he took my money, he forgot what I ordered until someone else ordered a slice of pepperoni and he GAVE THEM THEIRS. Then it occurred to him to ask, "What did you order again?" I mean seriously, a slice of pepperoni, it's not that hard. They've also forgot countless times that I ordered a drink. Why don't they watch TV at home?

So screw you Irving Pizza. I resist the temptation to eat you drunk or sober.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Ordered  margarita pizza which comes with tomatos and basil and in hour and a half im getting pizza from rude and stoned delivery person who has no change... but this is not it. its cold and has NO basil!!!! When i called back they to ask WTF they said that they actually out of basil just forgot to tell me.... the WORSE service experiense ever!!!

and shit pizza as well...

i wish they get shut down as their other location, or at least their staff should to get fired.
author: Tat R.

description: Had pizza from here recently thanks to the super cool owner of the Nitecap who bought pizza for her customers the other night.  Pizza had just arrived when I walked into the bar so it was still hot and steamy.  Never been to the actual restaurant, but the pizza was good and the price was right.  After a long day at work and with a nice drink finally in front of me, it was a most welcome surprise.
author: Roy N.

description:
The pineapple-ham and cheese slices are nice-- especially when you've got the late-night munchies, but these fools-- with the exception of one employee-- are incompetent, careless, assholes. 

To be honest, they are all nice, especially the younger brother in the family business, but the fact that these brothers are supposed to be running this place and are ALWAYS on the phone when I order, ALWAYS get my order wrong, ALWAYS burn my motherfucking slice, and ALWAYS give my pizza to someone else makes them assholes. 

Try harder idiots.
author: Angela M.

description:
What's better than a late night slice of pizza when your stumbling home from the bars?

It should be noted that I have never, ever eaten here while even remotely sober.  I have a feeling that this is run-of-the-mill mediocre pizza but after 8-12 drinks all I ever end up saying is, "Mmm-mmmm. That is a tasty slice."
author: Justin B.

description:
Waking up with pizza crust in one hand and my beloved teddy bear in the other was a little weird but aside from that, my inaugural visit to Irving Pizza was nothing short of spectacular. Who knew there was super yummy pizza in the loin? You mean I don't have to drag my sleepy stuff all the way to the Castro when I'm all crankypants, tired, and want late night pizza anymore? Shock! 

You can't go wrong with the pepperoni pizza OR the pesto. Yes, I had both. I've been going through it. Don't judge.  Also don't go overboard on the garlic powder unless you really hate the people you're with. And remember: falling asleep eating pizza is one thing. Falling asleep eating pizza and ranch sauce (they have a good one, btw) is a whole other deal. I'm sorry, Frette 800 thread count sheets! I'll have you in the washing machine in no time! I needed a shower anyway...
author: Autumn K.

description:
So, to be fair, I only had a cheese pizza, so not much room to impress me culinary-wise. But, still a pretty good slice! Nice thin crust, not too much sauce, and cheese in the kinda crispy perfect way pizza should be. 

Owned by the couple who own Amsterdam Cafe, so make it a night!
author: Allison A.

description:
There's a dark hole in the middle of the counter where you're encouraged to drop your tips.I dropped some change in there and I don't think I ever heard it land.

They make pretty good thin crust pizza and they're open late. I hope the staff gets their tips someday, because they sure deserve them.
author: matthew r.

description: Worst delivery I've ever experienced in the world. Ordered a pizza, salad combo with a 2 liter soda.  Order shows up an hour and 20 minutes later with a cold pizza in hand accompanied by a salad. Ask about 2 liter and I get an " I'm sorry" and $5 off and tells me he will return with 2 liter in 5 minutes. 30 minutes later and still no 2 liter hence this review.  Only reason for the 2 stars is because the pizza itself is not bed at all.
author: Jeff B.

description:
when you're plastered and your friend is passing out on the sidewalk outside, grab a slice of the cheese, and he'll be up and running in no time. Don't forget to steal a few bites for yourself. 

great pizza, best when intoxicated. the end.
author: Anne Marie S.

description: I only came here because we went bar hopping in around TL the other night. Nothing really fresh. They reheat it in a tiny oven in the front. Sitting in the front the pies looked like its been sitting for awhile because the cheese is all dry. The only reason I wouldn't die to come back if it were the last place on earth for a pizza was the worker in the front working the register. First of all, he was on his damn iphone trying to take my order while on a personal call. He had to ask like 4 times what was my order. Then watching serve the other in & out customers, he had an attitude like he was too good for them. Like really? don't work if you dont like dealing with customers that aren't even asking for unreasonable things. The pizza was okay but nothing special.
author: Jeff C.

description: To paraphrase Homer Simpson "the two sweetest words in the English language are De Fault!" That is exactly what this is late at night in the Sunset.  You will be impressed with the volume of different slices that have sausage on them.  Their pesto is a greasy masterpiece.  Enjoy any time but late night always seems better.
author: Jake S.

description:
You're out on a Tuesday night, not completely full from dinner, which anyways was hours ago, and you have that feeling that if you don't eat you'll wake up with a more excessive hangover than necessary. If you're on Geary around Larkin, like my friends and I were that evening, then you'd have been happy to know that Irving Pizza was there for you.

Quite tasty and hot, not slices that seemed re-heated. I went with a Hawaiian slice that hit the spot quite nicely. Nice counter guys too, seems like they've seen all manner of drunkard and shady character in there, so we were relatively tame.

They have another location on Irving and 19th, hence the name, so they must be doing something right. Will definitely try them soon again, perhaps for delivery this time. Really, more like 3.5 stars, you dig?
author: Nish N.

description:
Bad stuff. Tastes good when you're drizzed on a TL night.

Sort of OK wings.

Makes you take a big shit the next day.

For some reason every time I eat here, my shit smells like cigarettes. 

Haven't figured this out yet.
author: Andreas T.

description:
Pro's: reliable delivery

Con's: the food, prices not so cheap

The pizza is usually greasy with an underdone doughy crust. The Buffalo wings are not Buffalo wings at all, but are only fried chicken wings with no sauce or flavoring. 

Irving is ok if you're desperate and in a pinch for some food, but there are plenty of better places to get your pizza fix from.
author: Russ C.

description: this place is OK from what I recall. This is a review that I've been meaning to review but haven't until now like others I've been doing as of late. The pizza here was pretty good and I may bump it up a star if I give them another try.....I do remember this hood has a lot of characters to say the least!
