author: Richard G.

description: Mediocre slices, but cheap ones, that are open late, and satisfy your craving for that New York City style fold it in half and eat it greasily approach.  Certainly wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but if you're on the same block, you won't be disappointed by your purchase.
author: Zachary R.

description:
Ok, so you walk out of a bar in the 'Loin and it's late. You're kind of swerving and you're trying to rein in your drunk friends, a somewhat amusing experience. Then you notice a bright beacon illuminating the post-last call misty night, it's Irving Pizza...on Geary. Sure, that makes enough sense.
Irving Pizza serves slices that feel like they're saving your life at 3am. The kind of pieces you eat when you wake up the next day wondering how you got home and notice the cat licking a grease-stained paper plate littered with crushed red pepper flakes as you scramble around to make sure your wallet and phone made it home with you.
The counter guys at Irving Pizza are some of the most patient people I've ever come across, very diplomatic in their dealings with bums, miscreants, and people so intoxicated they made us look like a sober bunch.
author: Candice L.

description: Thin, $2.75 for cheese though not as much flavor as the actual Irving store - don't know if that was real or just me marking it down for the hood which is sketchy.  Went with my wife and she was not comfortable there.  Friendly service, small place and sketichiness about par for this part of town.
author: Jeff J.

description: Grab a slice of the veggie with pesto, add lots of chipotle tabasco and head over to Amsterdam Cafe to enjoy with many awesome beers.
author: Cori W.

description:
Wow, the power of mass-mail marketing! I'm such a sucker for any pizza joint that fits this category: "haven't had it/heard of it/new for me."

Can't say they are better than my current/local fave, Pizza Pino, but Irving slings a pretty decent pie (their cheese sticks weren't so great, though). Delivery was quick, too.
author: Derek R.

description:
There is seating inside Irving Pizza, but believe me, you want to eat your slice on the sidewalk. At 2AM on any given night, there's transvestite hookers, Oxycontin addicts and the down-and-out trying to cop a feel from those he-shes and bike-riding hipsters making snarky comments about all the above. Last weekend my friend and I got a treat: a carful of "normal" girls drove by and flashed their bazooms at us.

The pizza isn't bad either. The crusts are fresh and chewy. I rate the quality of Irving Pizza's late-night slices as above average (average = Cable Car Pizza).

Price of admission: $2.75 for cheese, $3.75 for hella topppings.
author: William L.

description:
I can safely say to you all, I am not a pizza connoisseur.  In Los Angeles, I subsisted on Papa Johns for pretty much my entire stay (except for the occasional Domino's trip because it is just so damned cheap!).

That said, I found Irving Pizza while wandering around my hotel, late at night, after my first day at my new job.  I was afraid nothing was going to be open.  To my delight, I caught a flash of light reflecting off their street sandwich-board.  I got a slice of pepperoni, and all was well in the world.  

I've since tried their what I am going to call supreme and their Canadian bacon with pineapple.  All hit the spot.  

My only concern is about how long the pies are sitting out before a slice or two are lucky enough to find a new home.  But, I never worry about that for very long.

FYI.  One slice is usually enough, and two is always too many.  I will be trying the jalapeno poppers next based off another review.  

Give it a go!
author: Eric W.

description:
Pro's: Open late. Order by the slice. Prices are cheap.

Cons: STOMACH ACHE! MORE STOMACH ACHE! PREPARE FOR THE PAIN!!!!! So..did I mention this place gives you a sore stomach? It might taste just ok but after you digest it....that is not something you want to think about.
author: Jay H.

description: I really like the crust here.  Its nice and crispy.  They don't skimp on the toppings..points... but the slices are pretty small :(
author: Jannea T.

description: Pizza is decent, but dealing with the employees at this location isn't worth it. They won't get any more of my money until they get rid of the current staff behind the counter and also doing deliveries.
author: Sarah D.

description:
It tasted sorta like pizza and I didn't get sick.

Although that's about all I can say.  I wouldn't get this before the late night hours though.
author: Rocco B.

description: Be sure to check the prices. Their website prices are lower than what you are quoted on the phone or in the pizzeria. They haven't fixed the discrepancy. So this basically means that if you order expecting one price, you might be asked to pay a somewhat higher price. It's not the biggest problem in the world, but it is annoying.
author: A A.

description:
As you can see from my reviews of Temple and Vertigo, this is my last stop on the way home from a good night on Polk St.  I don't think I have ever gotten pizza here before midnight.

     I mean, this place is by no means the best slice you'll ever have.  But for some reason, it is very comforting to know it is there and open at 3am to cater to your needs.  They reheat some pretty large slices for you for about $3-4, so it is pretty clutch.  They also give you a big tub of ranch dressing for no extra charge to slather all over your pizza so you can feel like a fat sloth in the morning.
author: Joey S.

description:
Like most bachelors, I'm a pathetic excuse for a cook. If my food didn't set off the smoke alarm half the time, I'd probably forget it was in the oven and just eat potato chips and clam dip for dinner.

Thankfully, Irving Pizza is directly across the street from my apartment.

This place itself ain't nothing special to look at. They only cook about 4 varieties - plain, pepperoni, Hawaiian, and deluxe - unless you custom order a whole pie for yourself. The slices are generous, however, and the crust is a perfect balance between chewy and crispy. Plus it's open late at night: 2 am on weekdays and 4 am on weeknights. Sure, sometimes the counter guys are a slow-step less than friendly...but you can hardly blame them when their paying customers are almost all blind drunk, while outside the drug dealers, schizos and crackheads take turns yelling at people (sometimes even invisible people) down the sidewalk.

My advice: Make sure you get one of their repeat-customer cards, because after every 6 slices you buy, you get a free slice and a soda of your choice. Considering how often I end up here, they may want to re-think that offer. I just might eat them out of business.

Go sober. Go drunk. Go.
author: John G.

description:
Irving Pizza is fantastic.  It has come to my drunchies rescue many a time (drunk + munchies = drunchies.) One time on CL, I responded to a discussion post about the city's best pizza, naming "Erving St. pizza on Geary" as my top choice, followed by North Beach Pizza.  Of course, some fool couldn't resist the urge to offer unsolicited feedback and sent me a message saying that it was actually spelled "Irving" and that the "flagship" location was actually on Irving St.  The flagship, eh?  It that like the motherboard of pizza?  All hail the flagship, for she is about to set sail. 

People who correct my spelling on craigslist deserve nothing more than Domino's.  As soon as I finish typing this, I am going to grab my pizza punch card and head over to Irving Pizza on Geary and grab me a slice.  Remember, after the 6th slice, it's free!
author: Becca A.

description:
I've noticed that my reviews are a lot less entertaining when I'm not hungover.  Sorry y'all, but I'm turning over a new leaf, so expect 30% less entertainment from here on out.  

Alas.

I think this pizza is better than average for San Francisco standards.  I also like it because it's in my 'hood.  Frankly, I really wish that Arinell or Serrano's were in my neighborhood, but they're not, so it's either this, Victor's, or Cybelle's.  Oh, and that one tenderloin spot that I'm convinced is a terrorist front.  That place is alright, but I don't hate America, so I opt for Irving.  Kidding.  I totally hate America. 

There's usually something good on TV if you wanna sit there and eat the pizza.  I remember seeing Seinfeld and WWF wrestling.  I'm into it. 

They have all kinds of fried seafood there too, which kind of intrigues me...
author: Coco D.

description:
every neighborhood ought to have its own drunk food. the place that all locals know to hit up post-clubbing, when you've got major munchies and need to soak up the alcohol in your stomach. when i was in high school, it was the diner. in college, it was a sandwich spot called little john's. post-college in DC, it was julia's empanadas. though i haven't found my perfect bay area spot yet (top dog is a strong contender), if i lived in the tendernob, it just might be irving pizza. 

big slices of lightly greasy NY pizza with lots of ooey-gooey cheese, does it get any better at 2am on a saturday?
author: Kris G.

description:
free delivery, no pork, entertaining characters outside, what more can you ask for? i've never had beef pepperoni before, but i approve. 

2 tiny tables inside, plus a counter that you can stand at to eat. most people take their pizza to go. you can get it on a paper plate or in an individual sized box. the tip jar is just a hole drilled into the counter. 

one slice was $3.50, no additional tax. the slices were cut slightly small, so he gave me two pieces for the price of one. win!
author: Anna S.

description: We stumbled into this spot to soak up all the beer and tequila that we had consumed at the house parties that we hit up earlier in the evening. It's a small spot, but the guys behind the counter were friendly, and didn't kick my drunk ass out for being loud and obnoxious after I had read the price for a medium pizza. I felt that $20 was too expensive for medium pizza in my drunken state, but calmed the fuck down after my guy assured me that the pizza was going to be bigger than a standard medium. My girlfriend ordered a peperoni/mushroom slice and shared with me while we sat and waited on the table outside. Overall, the pizza was okay. It was excellent when I was eating it to soak up the liquor, and was just okay the next day when I heated it up. Excellent crust, good flavorful sauce, and decent toppings.
author: Yvonne C.

description: Hard to remember ever having a worse pizza then this! Looks like the only people who give this Rats Nest a good review are out drinking late, with no other options, and anything tastes good...Barely any cheese, was probably sitting there for hours, because the guy took way too long to heat it up. Really cheap tasting pizza. Trust me this place is terrible!!!
author: Mike G.

description:
This place cemented my love for jalapeno poppers- best damn thing on the menu.  Decent fried chicken strips.  If you want some pizza, go grab a slice to go.  For sides, just call and have it delivered.  I swear to god, this last sunday I ate three of their slices after a night of whiskey and pbr.  I woke up the next morning feeling great, aside from the anxiety of wondering how well behaved I was the night before.

No 'restaurant' has seen more wrong sides of me than these guys.  Ok, maybe Chunky's can compare.  Maybe a little bit...  I admire their patience for the drunk crowd.
author: Ashby U.

description:
The Veggie Pizza with a wonderful pesto base is frequently good, but sometimes...well, not so much.  I guess it depends on how long it's been hanging out.  The Cheese is always awesome, and while I'm usually a super thin crust girl, I dig their crusty goodness almost always.  

The downside is...as mentioned, sometimes it's been sitting there for a bit.  Overall though, the hours are great for lunch to well past last call, and it's a quick cheap eat.
author: Miss A.

description: That nasty slice you sold me last night kept me up for hours with an upset stomache, I still like you better than the place around the corner.
author: Manny F.

description:
In 1964, U.S. Supreme Court Justice Potter Stewart famously said of obscenity, "I know it when I see it."

Well friends, I know good pizza when I taste it, and Irving Pizza is good - obscenely good, in fact.

It's quite remarkable that pizza this obscenely good can emerge from such an unassuming little joint. The crust is thick and chewy and will meet your FDA carbohydrate requirements for the next 36 hours. 

The boys in the kitchen are generous with the mozzarella, which I find particularly gratifying. They layer on the cheese with pornographic immodesty. When properly heated, an Irving pepperoni slice will secrete a discreet amount of orange-ish grease - just right. If you're lucky, the thin pepperoni slices will be curled up like petals on an orchid and blackened, quite exquisitely, at their edges.

Kindly note that I lavish my praise strictly on the pepperoni slices. Irving's sausage resembles rabbit poop in size and complexion. At least it tastes all right, if lackluster. Now c'mon boys. The best pizza sausage will resemble a misshapen testicle, let an embarrassment of grease when sizzled on the griddle, and extrude a bounty of caraway seeds. 

Quite alarmingly, I thought I spied a rabbit hopping around the kitchen late one night, the same night, in fact, on which I had encountered a fairy wearing boots outside the Hi Tide. Kindly note that I customarily patronize Irving Pizza after a thorough inspection of several Tenderloin dens of iniquity, so it is possible that I had been seeing things. 

In sum, four stars and three thumbs up to Irving Pizza and its fun & accommodating personnel!
author: Fred S.

description: In the race for worst pizza in the T.L this place is definitely a front runner. Bad service, expensive, and like I said above, despite the stiff competition for "Worst/Most Heat Lamped/Soggiest-Greasiest/Undercooked Pizza in the TL" awards. These guys have got to be the winners. Their proximity to various bars makes sure their "crappy pizza with a frown" restaurant style makes a boatload of money no matter how much the place sucks. One star if your sober [made me want to puke],to maybe a two star if you're tanked[made me forget to puke!].
author: Daniel S.

description: I had a two for one coupon.  It was a good deal.  The pizza...  not so much.  Piccolo's, Larkin and O'farrell.
author: CAPT i.

description: Eh, it's a'ight.  I was disappointed in my cheese fries big time because who the hell puts mozzarella on their cheese fries? NO CHEDDAR?!  Not the same.  My ninjas like the pizza but I prefer Napoli's since it's a leeetle closer to my hood.  Honestly though, beggars can't be choosers at 2:30am after drinking and smoking.  I'd probably have eaten a cardboard box if it smelled decent.
author: Jill D.

description: I saw someone coming out from the back (assuming he works there) casually picking his nose once. Uhhhh.........
author: Kirstie R.

description: HELLS YES! Irving pizza is rad.  I go frequently (although usually at 2am when I am hick-uping and causing unnecessary trouble).  But really though, late nite grub spot. Just be a little patient and try to to shove the thing in your mouth while it is still bubbling, ( I also tend to do this everytime because I am an idiot?!) cause then you will regret the slice in the morning. haha.
author: Rikki D.

description: I've had several slices here on my way to or from a night of drinking somewhere in the general area.  Today I placed a delivery order and one of the guys walked it over as they are close to me.  I had a fifty (thanks Grandma) in my wallet and about $25 in other miscellaneous bills but the food was $26 and some change.  The guy unfortunately didn't have change for a fifty but was cool enough to take the $25 and said, " just pay us next time."  Now that's customer service!  Their Tijuana Special pizza is excellent as are the steak fries.  The Greek salad gets a thumbs up as well.  Thanks guys, I'll drop off some money when I walk by next!
author: Derek D.

description:
i don't mind this place at all--even when sober.  i like the chicken sandwich, and their salads are pretty good for a pizza joint.  romaine lettuce, good amount of veggies (onions, tomatoes, peperoncini, black olives) and cheese.  they are also a nice size which could be a meal on its own or nicely split between two people for an appetizer.

for pizza i stick to basics like plain pepperoni or margherita.  crust is more chewy than thin and crisp but i don't mind that.  and the delivery until 3am on weekends has helped me dodge many a crack party on my building's doorstep which is probably why i keep utilizing it.

maybe i'm easy to please on this one or maybe i just don't expect much so i'm not disappointed, but irving is a-ok for me.
author: c. j.

description: Pizza is about what you'd expect for a place in the TL.  Good crust, pretty greasy, and overall nice and tasty.  The inside of the place is tiny, so it's best if you're just looking to grab a slice and run.
author: John H.

description: The pizza here has a thin crust and is cheesy, greasy, and saucy -- the kind that's great for satisfying those pizza cravings.  One slice will fill you (or kill you, depending on how you want to look at it).  They're open till really late (3am on Fridays and Saturdays) which gets them an extra star.  Cheap prices too -- $2.25 for a slice of cheese pizza.
author: Dinesh M.

description:
I love you San Francisco, I mean that I really do. I never thought I would love you so much when I stumbled into you a few years ago but it's true you are fantastic and I am head over heels for you, well not you Marina you are a suck hole. 
But really what is up with pizza spots that try to cook one slice of pizza? What the fucking hell is up with that! It is against nature people, pizza is a whole round pie, better than the sum of it's parts. This is so obvious when you wander drunk into some crap hole and you order a slice from the menu and they start piling shit on top of some triangle of crap. This is not good and I have never experienced it anywhere outside of this city! Maybe you are cost cutting or trying to make sure that everyone gets exactly what they want on their individual slice. But it's not ok. I demand that you stop calling these monstrosities pizza. 
Cook a couple of pies and if Billy and Suzy don't see a slice they can get down on then tell them to Go Fuck themselves! 

That said Irving pizza on Geary has whole pies which they remove slices from and then give them to you, this is the proper way people. I have only eaten here when I am wasted and need food in my tum but I like it. I like the guys that work here and their pie is decent and the slices extra large. 
Also I noticed they have Philly Cheesesteaks on the menu. I will probably need one of those after my next drink-stravaganza.
author: Melissa H.

description: Delicious pizza but way too pricy for how much food you get. I like the combination. The neighborhood leaves much to be desired as well.
author: James M.

description: OH MAN! It's the best! Especially after a hard night of partying at Edinburgh with all your cool friends after 90s night or something. HAHA. Anyway, great pizza, cheap, friendly people. It's great drunk and sober which really makes a big difference! Enjoy
author: Mish M.

description: I've had pizza here many times.  It's alright, nothing special.  Cheap and close if your drinking around Geary.  However my favorite spot is Napoli's around the corner from Irving on Polk and Post.  (Open late as well)  Their pizza is less greasy and they have a larger variety of choices.  I'll admit however, their patrons ARE far scarier.  But worth the extra walk and extra crazy talk for better pizza.
author: Mary R.

description: Good pizza and subs. I tend to order from this place at least once a week because I'm too lazy too cook. I end up getting a sub and mozz sticks. You can order beer and wine for delivery. So far one of my favorite pizza joints. Pizza sub is great too. Always 45 mins for delivery.
author: Jessica S.

description: At the time I was eating it I would have almost gone for four stars.  Granted it was two-thirty in the morning, and I had more than my fair share of tequila shots.  The plain pepperoni hit the spot, and I woke up feeling much better than I deservesd to!
author: Amme P.

description: I've eaten more orders of chicken strips and fries from this place than I care to admit.  In fact, I think I've received more deliveries from Irving Pizza than I have any other restaurant in my neighborhood.   In addition to the chicken strips, I've had their fish and chips, various sandwiches, and a few different pizzas -- all which have usually arrived at my door fresh and warm.  (I think there was one time the delivery took an unusually long time but, hey, we all have off days.)  The bbq sauce served with the chicken strips has quite a kick and I always order extra tubs of their delicious ranch dip for my fries.  Even better?  They offer late hours to accommodate us night owls!
author: Katrina J.

description:
It's a nice place to stumble into late at night.  It always seems to have a crowd, and the people who run the place seem to have a good attitude given the above average level of obnoxiousness from the average customer.  I will always love this place because I saw a guy trip through the front door,  then attempt to store a bottle of soda (probably purchased from the convenience store next door) in the inside pocket of his jacket, only to have it flood the interior left side of his casual yet progressive attire with carbonated hummingbird sweat.  

And yes, they also have food.
author: Jay G.

description:
at 3am: 5-star pizza
(really, when I'm drunk, I could eat the cardboard plate and not even notice)
at 3pm: 5-star pizza, 1-star service...

Whenever I hit up this place in the afternoon, that knobby-nosed fucker behind the counter is always watching TV.  The past two times, he's fucked up my order, and once even forgot that I already paid him two minutes beforehand.

TURN OFF THE TV and GET TO WORK, dipshit!  
and it's not like the World fucking Series was on TV last time... it was
Nickel-fuckin-lodeon!
author: Lucky P.

description:
dont order this pizza if you value your intestines!! 

Went on yelp to find out about this pizza shop before i ordered, ignored the negative comments because the drunks gave a few good reviews and me and two friends ordered a pepperoni pizza.

the pizza was covered in dripping thick grease, and not the normal pizza grease but  the kind that doesnt help when dabbing it with a napkin. 

The extra large pizza and fries were $30.00, the potato fries that we ordered were lacking seasoning but all and all it was good. 

The three of us only ate the fries and one slice of pizza each, the grease made us all sick and we spent the rest of the night in the bathroom regreting not paying attention to the review.  

I love pizza no matter what but for the first time ever i tosed the left overs and vowed not to order again, i hope my stomach forgives me. 

bottom line greasy gross pizza at a high price!!
author: ben b.

description: decent pizza. would give 3 or maybe 4 stars but this pizza has made me sick (bathroom sick) more times than not.
author: chris b.

description: After losing my battle with motion sickness during a drive to Big Sur, I was absolutely starving as we waited for the bus to take us back to our hotel. I looked behind me and saw pizza in the window, went in and grabbed a slice of cheese. So good. Heavy on the cheese, light on the sauce with a perfectly sized crust. It totally hit the spot. The only thing that sucked was that I was only halfway done with it when the bus showed up, so I had to wait until I got back to the hotel to eat the second half.
author: Monica T.

description: Pretty unbelievable. We placed an order online with them and were told 45-60 minutes for delivery. An hour and 20 minutes later we checked in to find out where on earth our food was, and were told they "lost our order" and food would arrive within 30-35 minutes. 45 minutes after that, we checked back in (again!) to find out where on earth our food was, and we were told it would be there in 5-7 minutes. 15 minutes later, we checked back in for a third time (pretty hungry by this point) to find out where our food was, and ask for a refund, at which point we were told to "hang on" while the guy checked on something, and we were hung up on. Called back 5-7 minutes after THAT and were told that WE had requested to cancel our order. WE had NOT. Really...truly, unbelievable. Our card has already been charged. When we inquired about our refund, we were told that the bank may take 5-7 business days to complete our refund. Still Hungry. Still no food. We will never be using Irving Pizza again.
author: Cole S.

description: Having had nothing but bland, dry pizza since moving here, stopping by this place was the best thing I could have done. I usually grab a slice of veggie and a meat slice, but this place took that a step up from the usual. The veggie pizza comes with an AMAZING pesto sauce that just enhances all the flavor of all the veggies, and the Irving Special or whatever comes with pepperoni, salami, sausage, bell peppers, and mushrooms. So good! And at $2.95 a slice, it's a pretty good deal. Looks like they have good lunch specials too. Definitely need to go back then!
author: Brett B.

description: Forget the pizza. Get the chicken wings. They are a-m-a-z-i-n-g. I used to come here for pizza because it's pretty decent and cheap but then I noticed that they had a bunch of other menu items. My friend got the chicken Cesar and I got the wings. The wings are a bit pricey and I even told the pizza dude so. It's like $6.46 for half dozen. Makes KFC look like a bargain, but (holy cock, batman!) the best little fried chicken wings this side of Polk EVER! And the Cesar was good, too. Deep friend chicken on a salad with creamy dressing? Yum-O. It's like Rachel Ray on crack.
author: TaDao V.

description: Where else can you get pizza at 3AM? When the kitchen is closed in the restaurant you work in and you've been working all night and haven't eaten, this is the place to go... or have them deliver. I've never actually been there. I've only had two different pizzas from them. Consider this a prelim review. So far so good.
author: Hunter G.

description: The single slices are really good. The crust is really crunchy and delicious. But when you buy a whole pizza, it ends up soggy by the time you get it home. I will go back for the slices only.
author: Mina P.

description: You can get anything you want on your pizza all you have to do is ask! Like one time I took a plain slice and made it into a chicken, mushroom and onion slice- for the same price! Plus, their garlic fries with ranch dressing are pretty tasty too. The pizza isn't  what you're used to if you've sampled  Chicago or New York pies but at bar time, it's pretty delicious.
author: Jessica M.

description: Underrated pizza, ideal for sponging the stomach following a night of seeing some underrated local bands a few doors down at Edinburgh Castle. Counter fellas are true gents.
author: j h.

description:
Very rarely will I give a place 5 stars, but this place is great. Slices for under $3, and they aren't greasy, with a crispy crust.

I always grab a slice on my way home from work, whenever I feel a tad bit hungry. And not many places I know have a slice card, where when you buy 6 slices you get 1 free. Usually its buy 10 get 1 free, so they get an extra star for that added value!!

I eat at this place at all times of the day (lunch, dinner, after drinking). Great place, and polite staff.
author: S. S.

description:
don't order from this place. 

if yer gonna eat the food from this joint, make sure yer in the establishment, face-to-face, looking at your order taker. i'm all for the diversity of america. i find it one of the most important aspects of this society we inhabit. but this place just boils down to ignorance and laziness. they apparently don't understand the english language over the phone and certainly don't give a rat's ass about customer service...

hey Irving! i can go to any other pizza joint within a two-block radius of you...that numbers somewhere in the teens. so, if you find that business runs smoothly when you don't listen to your customers, you will hopefully come to a rude awakening.

multiple times i have ordered from this joint and multiple times i have had my order received insanely late and wrong...well, no more. no longer will i put myself through the irritating strife of an ignorant (no...let's say DUMB) order-taker and delivery person. either stop the delivery service or get better at it. as for me, i'm done with you.

if yer looking for your former customers, Irving, go next door or up the block, or around the corner, or down the street, or even across town...anywhere but in your establishment.
author: the r-o- b.

description: late night yummy. go there. The greek salad is wonderful and if there is mushroom/pepperoni slices available, go for it!
author: L T.

description: I know Irving's pizza like the back of my hand - this is my neighborhood joint and I've eaten here a lot!    They don't have a lot of fancy choices, but they are consistently tastey.  They use pesto on the veggie slices and the crust is better than most.  Basically, this place is not gormet, but it's still pretty good, and I enjoy eating there at least once a week.  If anyone knows of a better place to go near Geary and Larkin, let me know.  For now, I'd say it's the best pizza in the Tenderloin.
author: Margaret S.

description: i love sriracha and the "orange sauce", but i just found another new favorite. the chipotle tabasco was awesome on top of the pizza. it's thicker and has a different taste to it. and on this slice, it was heaven. slices are cheap, and warmed up quickly. they also have a solid looking menu that i may have to try out in the future. definately not just a pizza place. since it is close to hayes valley, i'll probably start ordering in from here. perfect end to a drunken/hig night out in the TL
author: Andrew T.

description: Ok so hear is the deal! I was staying at a crappy hotel in the crappiest part of town! BUT! Low and behold I was drunk as hell at 1 am in the morning and I got off the bus (the 19) and it stopped right in front of this little pizza joint. Needless to say it is the best slice of pizza I have had in a LONG time. One slice about feels you up. So the next day I went back to this little pizza joint to feed my hunger and I noticed they had other things besides pizza. I ordered a philly cheese steak and my god that thing was fantastic. Never thought that a place that had pizza would have cheese burgers and other food that tastes amazingly fantastic. I gave it a 4 star only cuz crazy bums and hookers can be found close by lol. If you are in the TL and are looking for a CHEAP and FANTASTIC place to eat this is it. Oh did I mention that phiily cheese steak was only 7 bucks and came with a crap ton of fries! Overall this place is a real good value and has good food!
author: Travis C.

description: I hate the one on irving, and this one was not any better. BF got a pizza, I saw the guy touch money, getting from another customer, then using the server to get the pizza slice, and the hand that touched money, one of his fingers touched the crust of the pizza slice meant for my bf - to push the slice closer on the surface to the pizza server, so he could put it in the oven. DISGUSTING!!!!
author: Janet W.

description: the pizza itself merits 3 stars.  the crust was kind of burnt and a little flavorless.  still, the slices are piping hot, greasy, and cheesy, and really hit the spot when you're craving pizza.  additionally, i have to give this place another star for the awesomely frightening sign outside their door: a fanged pizza holding up a dripping knife-shaped piece of itself.  TIME FOR A SLICE!!!
author: Katherine K.

description: pizza was ok, nothing special, definitely not what i would call new york style pizza.  with the lunch special it was affordable.  the dough was good the rest of it was a little weird.  i think they use breakfast sausage for there sausage pizza.  i would probably give them a 3 but i accidentally left my bag under the table and they snagged it up and put it behind the counter for when i came back so they get an extra star for that.
author: Colin T.

description: i love meat on my pizza.  as a matter of fact when ordering any type of food i avoid the  v-word (vegetarian) as much as possible.  however, it came to a great shock to me to realize that some v-word options were not just half bad but had the potential to be really really good.  irving pizza taught me this lesson by creating the 'green special' pizza:  pesto, feta, broccoli, artichokes and garlic (yeah no meat).  we ordered this at work to compromise with the non-meat eaters.  after the first bite i was sooo distracted by all the ingredients and  flavors that i forgot to complain about the lack of meat.  now thats a good sign of a well made meat-less pizza.
author: Lucy M.

description: I am very biased about pizza...I LOVE IT.  Even the worst pizzas taste wonderful to me, so I"m not sure how unbiased this review is... but I actually thought this pizza was decent, not amazing but a filling,substantial slice for $2.50
author: Michele Y.

description: If your in the loins and want a late night slice of pizza, I recommend Irving on Geary.
author: john b.

description: This is going to sound funny, but I don't go there for their pizza. You have to try their chicken sandwich it is absolutely delicious! The pizza on the other hand, not so delicious!
author: Bob S.

description: this is the place i usually go to if i want some pizza late at night and it has always been pretty good, sometimes they overcook it and it may seem too salty at times but overall i like this place, its good late nite tasty pizza...
author: selina k.

description: ok. i had to write a review, only because i live right next to this place, eat here four times a week, and was so blown away by the fact that yelp lists this place as nob hill!!! everything on the north side of the geary.... sweat! i no longer live in the TL. anywho, pizza is yummy (don't order sausage, they have the unfortunate rabbit turd kind), as is the philly cheese steak and fries. although i doubt it can claim nieman ranch beef status.
author: Whitney F.
